name: Weiqing Wang 0001
content: Teresa Wang - Monash University View Scopus Profile Teresa Wang Dr Senior Research Fellow, Department of Data Science & AI https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9578-819X EmailTeresa.Wangmonashedu Accepting PhD StudentsPhD projectshttps://supervisorconnect.it.monash.edu/projects/research/leveraging-artificial-intelligence-deorphanisation-g-protein-coupled-receptors 20122026 Research activity per year Personal profile BiographyDr. Teresa Wang is accepting PhD with scholarship provided: the link to project details.  The applicate due date is 25th/Sep. Dr. Teresa Weiqing Wang is currently a senior lecturer (roughly equivalent to the level of "associate professor" in North American universities) in data science with Faculty of Information Technology, Monash University. She previously worked as a post-doctoral research fellow at Data and Knowledge Engineering (DKE) Group, the University of Queensland, where she also obtained her Ph.D. degree. She obtained both her bachelor degree in Software Engineering and master degree in Computer Science from Nanjing University.Research interestsDr. Teresa Wang's current main research interests include entity/user modelling, relational/structural and spatial/temporal machine learning, graph/network construction and analysis, and recommender systems. She is especially interested in social data, eCommerce data, and health/medical data modelling.  For more information, please refer to her pages: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=jCziD10AAAAJ&hl=en and https://wwqnju.bitbucket.io/Monash teaching commitmentDr. Teresa Weiqing Wang was the director of Master of Data Science Program and also has the teaching experience for the following unit in the Faculty of IT: FIT5201 Machine LearningFIT9136 Algorithms and programming foundations in Python Expertise related to UN Sustainable Development Goals In 2015, UN member states agreed to 17 global Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, protect the planet and ensure prosperity for all.
